intro: Dichromena ruiziana var. triceps, commonly known as the three-veined dichromena, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves with three prominent veins, giving it its common name. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. This species is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
